page.title: 02Highbrook - Landscape
page.content: The whole area occupies a small part of the High Weald- an area of low hills and valleys. Much of the land has a cover of woodland giving the impression that the fields are clearings within a large wood. Minor roads traverse the area, generally in a north/south direction following the ridges. There is only one centre of habitation, Highbrook, a small hamlet with a village hall and a church. All other dwellings are isolated farmsteads or cottages scattered fairly evenly throughout. To the south east are four hammer ponds linked by a small stream flowing north east to cross the lane at Twyford in a ford. The climate tends to be somewhat colder than the surrounding low weald due to the altitude of the ridges. Frost and snow lie longer on the north facing slopes.
